Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.flappybird.controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActionListener, KeyListener, EventListener
public class GameController extends Object implements ActionListener, KeyListener
Controls the game logic, user inputs, and game state updates for the Flappy Bird game. The GameController manages bird movement, pipe generation, collision detection, and scoring.

This class uses Timer to handle the game loop and pipe generation, ensuring smooth gameplay mechanics.

Example usage: 

     GameController controller = new GameController(gamePanel, bird, pipes, gameState);

Since:
2024-12-02
Author:
Omkar Kshirsagar

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController(GamePanel gamePanel, Bird bird, ArrayList<Pipe> pipes, GameState gameState)
      Constructs a GameController to manage the Flappy Bird game's logic and inputs.

      Initializes the game loop timer (60 FPS) and pipe generation timer (every 1.5 seconds). Attaches the KeyListener to the game panel for user input handling.

      Parameters:
      gamePanel - The GamePanel object displaying the game visuals.
      bird - The Bird object controlled by the player.
      pipes - The ArrayList of Pipe objects acting as obstacles.
      gameState - The GameState representing the current game state.

  • Method Details

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e)
      Handles game loop actions such as moving game objects and repainting the screen. Stops the game if the game over condition is met.
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface ActionListener
      Parameters:
      e - The ActionEvent object triggered by the game loop timer.

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
      Handles key press events.
      • Pressing the spacebar makes the bird jump.
      • Restarts the game if the game is over.
      Specified by:
      keyPressed in interface KeyListener
      Parameters:
      e - The KeyEvent object representing the key press.

    • keyTyped

      public void keyTyped(KeyEvent e)
      Unused method from the KeyListener interface.
      Specified by:
      keyTyped in interface KeyListener
      Parameters:
      e - The KeyEvent object representing the key typed event.
